main event: Radar sighting of an unidentified object circling near the center of Culver City, California on February 13, 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed turning in a 35-degree direction.
The object was described as extremely small, but information indicates it was reexamined on multiple attempts.
The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes.
The weather was clear with 7 miles of visibility.
There was normal air traffic from several busy municipal airports in the area.
sighted object: round object, about the size of a dime, hovering and turning in a clockwise circle
